reviewText: Being fond of Tess Harper, I made a point of catching this when it was on network TV. The young actors do a competent job, but I find that Harper is so quintessential in bringing out even a minor role such as the mother of the missing girl. Based on a true story, the plot revolves around a spoiled selfish rich boy who has his all-American sweetheart at his own school, and another lusty interest played by Soleil Moon Frye, a poor girl from the wrong side of the tracks. The pacing is interesting with the scenes switching from one love interest to another as if to compare the emotional intensity of the two relationships. However, Tess Harper steals the show as the worried mom concerned about her missing daughter. Worth the time.
Title: N/A

reviewText: High School is a nightmare in this teen thriller of love gone wrong and the 2 women who try to make things right.Some boys have all the luck and Greg Dunleavy (Mark Krassenbaum) is one of them. Rich, popular, and athletic, he is also dating the most beautiful girl in school, Nicole Voss (Ari Meyers), but Greg is guarding a fatal secret.Emily (Soleil Moon Frye), a young girl from the wrong side of the tracks, has gone missing. Initially, nobody links the event to Greg, and the police investigation unearths no clues. However, an unlikely alliance forms between Greg's girlfriend, Nicole, and Emily's distraught and grief-stricken mother, Tina (Tess Harper), and the 2 begin to look into Emily's disappearance on their own.Soon, Nicole makes a shocking discovery that convinces her Greg is connected to Emily and to her disappearance. With no definitive evidence against him, Tina and Nicole set a trap for Greg that will prove his guilt if it doesn't prove deadly for Nicole first.
